units.title: Harvest and processing of organoids for peptidome analysis
units.text: On the day of harvest, organoids were removed from the 6-well culture plates using medium and P1000 pipettes and spun down for 8 min at 500 g with the brakes off. Cell pellets were then incubated with Cell Recovery Solution (Roche Diagnostics) for 30 min on ice to remove excess BME. Cells liberated from BME were then washed three times in excess PBS to remove any residual BME. After the last wash, all PBS was removed and the tube opening was quickly dried using a paper towel. Cell pellets were snap frozen in dry ice and stored at −80 °C.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, actionable protocol for harvesting and preparing organoids for downstream proteomic analysis, including critical steps like BME removal and snap freezing.

units.title: Organoid lysis and protein preparation for digestion
units.text: Organoids were lysed by gentle vortexing in 8 M Urea in 50 mM ammonium bicarbonate supplemented with 50 µg/ml DNAse I (Sigma-Aldrich), 50 µg/ml RNAse A (Sigma-Aldrich) and 1× complete EDTA-free protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche Diagnostics). Subsequently, the lysate was cleared by centrifugation for 1 h at 18,000 g at 15 °C. Protein concentration was determined with the Bradford assay (Bio-Rad). For each sample, 20 µg of total protein was reduced, alkylated, and digested sequentially with Lys-C (1:100) and trypsin (1:75).
units.rationale: This describes a precise, stepwise procedure for lysing organoids and preparing proteins for mass spectrometry, including reagents, concentrations, and enzymatic digestion conditions.

units.title: Peptide fractionation using high-pH reversed-phase chromatography
units.text: For high-pH reversed-phase fractionation, peptide digests were loaded on C18 STAGE-tips in 200 mM ammonium formate at pH 10 and eluted into 5 fractions with 11–80% acetonitrile. All samples were dried by vacuum centrifugation and reconstituted in 10% formic acid prior to LC-MS/MS analyses.
units.rationale: This outlines a standardized method for peptide fractionation prior to LC-MS/MS, including buffer conditions, elution gradient, and sample preparation steps.

units.title: LC-MS/MS analysis of peptide fractions
units.text:
Per fraction, three technical replicates were measured by LC-MS/MS.
Crypts of the healthy portion of the colonic epithelium (at least 10 cm away from the tumor side) were isolated by digestion of the intestinal mucosa in chelation solution (5.6 mM Na2HPO4, 8.0 mM KH2PO4, supplemented with dithiotreitol (0.5 mM, Sigma) and EDTA (2 mM, in-house) for 30 min at 4 °C. Colonic crypts were subsequently plated in basement membrane extract (BME; Cultrex PC BME RGF type 2, Amsbio).
units.rationale: This specifies the replication and analytical method used for peptide detection, a critical procedural detail for reproducibility.

units.title: Culture conditions for human intestinal organoids
units.text: Organoids were grown in human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM), which is composed of Advanced Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium/F12 supplemented with penicillin/streptomycin, 10 mM HEPES and Glutamax (all Gibco, Thermo Fischer Scientific) with 50% Wnt3a conditioned medium (in-house), 20% R-Spondin1 conditioned medium (in-house), 10% Noggin conditioned medium (in-house), 1x B27, 1.25mM N-acetyl cysteine, 10 mM nicotinamide, 50 ng/ml human EGF, 10 nM Gastrin, 500 nM A83-01, 3 µM SB202190, 10 nM prostaglandine E2 and 100 µg/ml Primocin (Invivogen).
units.rationale: This is a comprehensive and specific recipe for the organoid culture medium, a key procedural component for reproducibility.

units.title: Dissociation and plating of tumor cells for organoid culture
units.text: Tumor biopsies were digested into single cells using collagenase II (1 mg/ml, Gibco, Thermo Fischer Scientific), supplemented with hyaluronidase (10 µg/ml) and LY27632 (10 µM) for 30 min at 37 °C while shaking. Dissociated tumor cells were plated in BME and organoids were cultured in HISCM minus Wnt conditioned medium and supplemented with 10 µM LY27632 at 37 °C.
units.rationale: This describes the precise enzymatic dissociation and culture conditions for tumor-derived organoids, including critical inhibitors and media modifications.

units.title: Clonal organoid derivation via FACS sorting
units.text: To generate clonal tumor organoid lines, early passage tumor organoids were dissociated into single cells by TryPLE express (Thermo Fischer Scientiﬁc), washed and suspended in FACS buffer (PBS with 2 mM EDTA and 5% FCS). Prior to FACS purification, DAPI was added to the FACS buffer. HLA-A2+ single cells were sorted into separate wells of 96-well plates containing 100 µl HISCM with 10 µM LY27632 and coated with BME. Sorted cells were then covered with 10 µl BME and placed in the incubator at 37 °C. LY27632 was added to the HISCM for the first week after sorting.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, step-by-step protocol for clonal organoid isolation using FACS, including cell sorting criteria, plate preparation, and inhibitor timing.

units.title: DNA extraction and library preparation for whole-genome sequencing
units.text: Organoids were dissociated and DNA was isolated using the QiaSymphony DSP DNA Mini Kit (Qiagen; 937236). Libraries were prepared using the Illumina TruSeq DNA Nano Library Prep Kit (20015964). Paired-end sequencing of the organoid lines was performed (2 × 150 bp) on the generated libraries with 30× coverage using the Illumina HiSeq X Ten sequencing system at the Hartwig Medical Foundation.
units.rationale: This provides a clear, reproducible protocol for DNA extraction and sequencing library preparation, including kit catalog numbers and sequencing parameters.

units.title: Somatic mutation analysis pipeline
units.text: Somatic mutations were analyzed by the HMF somatic mutation workflow from https://github.com/hartwigmedical/pipeline which was installed the pipeline locally using GNU Guix with the recipe from https://github.com/UMCUGenetics/guix-additions. Brieﬂy, sequence reads were mapped against human reference genome GRCh37 using Burrows-Wheeler Alignment (BWA-MEM) v0.7.5a. Subsequently, somatic single-base substitutions (SBSs) and small insertions and deletions (INDELS) were determined by providing the genotype and tumor (or organoid for in vitro analysis) sequencing data to Strelka v1.0.14 with adjustments as described in58.
units.rationale: This describes the exact computational pipeline and tools used for somatic variant calling, including software versions and input parameters, essential for method reproducibility.
